**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 127 1.1 **Usage** affixed to armor or a weapon --- The first of these strips of glittering cloth was worn by a [monk](/Classes.aspx?ID=8) from Jinin who would interweave it into his [_handwraps of mighty blows_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=441). The spell DC of any spell cast by activating this item is 24.
  • **Armor** You gain a +2 item bonus to saving throws against [illusions](/Traits.aspx?ID=92) and [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) checks to [Create a Diversion](/Actions.aspx?ID=45).
  • **Weapon** ([visual](/Traits.aspx?ID=163)) After you cast an illusion spell by activating the scarf, the weapon is shrouded in a mesmerizing illusory pattern. Your next Strike causes the target to be [confused](/Conditions.aspx?ID=5) for 1 round if it hits. If you don't make a Strike by the end of your next turn, the illusion ends with no effect.
Lightweave Scarf **Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 127 1.1 **Price** 500 gp --- Lightweave Scarf (Greater) **Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 127 1.1 **Price** 5,500 gp --- The item bonus when affixed to armor is +2, and spell DC is 34. Lightweave Scarf (Major) **Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 127 1.1 **Price** 22,000 gp --- Item bonus when affixed to armor is +3; when affixed to a weapon, creatures are confused for 1 minute; and the spell DC is 38.
